thread.title: Seattle Seahawks Week 4 grades

author: STEPHEN COHEN, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: Seattle Seahawks Week 4 grades
text:
The Seattle Seahawks find themselves on a two-game winning streak that evened-up their record one quarter of the way through the 2015 NFL season, but they have to feel like they made a great escape on Monday night.
True, the Hawks outplayed the Detroit Lions for much of the teams' nationally televised matchup, but only a game-saving play from strong safety Kam Chancellor prevented Seattle from giving away a 13-10 lead late in the fourth quarter.
It was a tale of two sides of the ball for the Seahawks: The offense continued to be weighed down by a dreadful performance by the line, and quarterback Russell Wilson wasn't able to conjure his magic on every single play they needed him to.
On defense, Seattle stifled Detroit throughout, allowing them just one red zone opportunity. And when it looked like the Lions might take advantage of that opportunity to steal a win, Chancellor came through.
We re-watched the game and handed out our grades for each Seahawks position group. Check them out in the gallery below.
